name: places/ChIJn-Ah-fVYwokRPowskcZYWL8
adrFormatAddress: 1865 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text:
If you're in the Columbus Circle area and you need to stop to use a restroom, I recommend the one at the American Bible Society.  I do not take advantage of their other services, which I imagine are more religious in nature, but I have availed myself of their public restroom on many occasions and it is one of the best.

The Good:  Clean.  Almost always empty.
The Bad:  Not very big, so if someone is in there with you (rare), you don't have much separation.

Usually clean, and almost always empty, the American Bible Society restroom is worth a visit.  8.5 out of 10

originalText.text: Incredible! We got to meet Dr. Lupas, the most brilliant librarian on the plant. The collection of Bibles as historical artifacts are impressive. We where able to see Bibles carried through the Civil War - some of them had names of fallen comrades written inside the jacket cover. I would recommend anyone to swing by and see the exhibit at the "Museum of Biblical Art". The curation is great and is what you'd expect in a NYC experience. Have fun!

originalText.text: Have not visited it yet, but will next month.  My main purpose is to address Glenn Rauch.  You are not funny or clever, and actually come across as a clown.
